newsitem.title: USA: OPTIONS - U.S. T-bond options vols slightly bid.
newsitem.headline: OPTIONS - U.S. T-bond options vols slightly bid.

text.p: Implied volatilities for U.S. Treasury bond futures-options were very slightly firmer by late Monday, but brokers said activity stayed subdued mainly ahead of Thursday's U.S. June employment report.
"Into tommorow's (NAPM) data it's slightly firmer, but it's not even firm enough to comment on," said a broker at the Chicago Board of Trade. "It's pretty unchanged on the day."

She quoted August at-the-money futures-options at 7.7/7.85 percent, September at 8.10/8.17 percent, and December at 8.26/8.40 percent, all up a couple of tenths "but nothing to talk about before FOMC."

"Volatility has been a little bit bid over the course of the day," added another floor broker, who said some shorts will probably cover before the long weekend and after reaping so much profit already.
"The (likelihood) at this point for a continued selloff in volatility is limited," he added.
He quoted the August 111 straddle and the September 110/112 strangle each at just under 8.0 percent on Monday.
The first floor broker expected some players who have been profitably short volatility to cash in before Thursday's jobs data, but she doubted all would flock toward the exits.

"Over the last several weeks and with today's quiet markets, players have done really well being short volatility, and they've got so much in it now I can't see what the risk-reward of staying short at this point is," she added.
"But net/net people still want to be short because of the long (holiday) weekend," she said. "(So) you'll see them covering in...mostly in short-dated stuff like August."
Featured activity Monday included one commission house that bought 5,000 deep out-of-the-money August 115 calls at 1/64, possibly for another firm, said the second broker.

The first broker said she saw intraday spec buying of August 110 puts, which she said were mainly covered by Monday's close. She also noted firm position-maintenance, with one dealer seen doing August 110-113 combos by selling calls and buying puts with a 0.65 percentage point skew.
